July 19, 64 AD: The Burning of Rome 
After discovering that Nero had no intention of placing Apocalypse as a god before the Roman people, members of Clan Akkaba revolted in full force – starting a catastrophic fire that caused widespread devastation and death to its citizens. 
Casualties: 500 –­ 1,000 
See the full destruction of Apocalypse here: http://fox.co/ApocalypseTimeline Timeline Photos

August 24, 79 AD: The Eruption of Mount Vesuvius 
Disgusted by their gluttony and overabundance of sin, Apocalypse unleashed the full might of his power against the city of Pompeii – erupting Vesuvius and burying thousands beneath a mountain of ash. 
Casualties: 20,000 
See the full destruction of Apocalypse here: http://fox.co/ApocalypseTimeline Timeline Photos

430 BC: Mysterious Plague in Athens 
Defying Apocalypse as a peasant amongst their gods, Clan Akkaba condemned the people of Athens and unleashed a pestilence that infected their land – leading to the horrific death of thousands. 
Casualties: 75,000 – ­100,000 
See the full destruction of Apocalypse here: http://fox.co/ApocalypseTimeline Timeline Photos

1200 BC: The Decline of the Mycenaeans 
The leaders of the Mycenaeans shunned Apocalypse’s offer to join him – cursing his name and proclaiming him a false god. To demonstrate his power and set an example to the world, Apocalypse ordered Clan Akkaba to ravage and execute every member of the Mycenaean village. 
Casualties: 225,000 
See the full destruction of Apocalypse here: fox.co/ApocalypseTimeline Timeline Photos

Atlantis Sinks
After building a strong following of worshippers, Apocalypse created a paradise for his loyal followers. Once these individuals stopped worshipping him as the god he was, however, he wiped out the entire population with his powers of destruction. 
Casualties: 20,000 – 40,000 
See the full destruction of Apocalypse here: fox.co/ApocalypseTimeline Timeline Photos

To celebrate the launch of this hit movie’s DVD and Blu-Ray, Hot Toys is delighted to present the new 1/6th scale Wolverine Collectible Figure from X-Men: Days of Future Past.
